| subsid = Norwegian East Africa Line
}} The 'Norwegian America Line' (), was a cruise ship line, originally an
operator of passenger and cargo ships. Founded in 1910, the company ran a
regular transatlantic service between Norway and the United States, and later
included a route to East Africa as well.

Primarily due to competition from air travel, transatlantic passenger voyages
were discontinued in 1971.
